awd_titl_txt: Mathematical Sciences: Exact Results in Statistical         Mechanics
awd_abstract_narration: One of the fundamental problems in statistical mechanics                   is to bridge the gap between macroscopic, phenomenological laws                 - e.g., hydrodynamical and kinetic equations -and the                           underlying microscopic description involving interactions                       between a large number of particles.  The  delicacy of the                      problem can be appreciated if we consider that the microscopic                  laws are (time) reversible while the macroscopic are                            irreversible (Zermelo's "paradox").  Professor Goldstein plans                  to continue his investigations into problems- e.g., the                         derivations of diffusion equations, stochastic behavior, and                    convergence to equilibrium and the steady state- whose                          solutions would narrow this gap.
